content.description: An steep arete line with the usual holds here and there.
content.location: Far down of the north facing black wall of Gneiss Canyon,

content.description: The upper crack really draws the eye and I was so happy a series of holds lead directly up to it. This is the rightmost route on the panel currently. Begin about 10 feet right of Eye Bleech, under a series of small roofs. Work your way through the overlaps to then angle up right to the hanging crack system. Be pleasantly surprised to find a hand crack in what appears to be a fist or offwidth crack and jam the left-angling crack to a ledge with a bolted anchor.
Staged Access has some face traverse moves left to gain access to a set of chimneys and blocks leading to the grand stage above.
content.location: About 60 feet right of Lean Off on the west end of broad ledge with a group of 4 face climbs.

content.description: Face up a steep slab with some crack moves.
content.location: 2nd route to the right of Staged Access.

climbs.name: New Route Goofin'
climbs.fa: FA: Jeff Slater, Jason Haas, Bryan Prater, Austin Leech, Erika Nelson-Wong 10/2020

content.description: Head 100 yards left from Fish Angling to find this sport route on a tan buttress. Pull over a small overlap and then swim up jugs to the sixth bolt. Make a sneaky transition hard right and then up to the last bolt. Cut right again into a hidden hand crack/corner (optional #2 Camalot) and climb to a ledge with a bolted anchor. The rock is a bit crumbly and the sequences can be hard to read. With that said, I thought it was still a fun warm up for the area.
An easy line leads to the final zone of moves that are so obvious.  Crack & face
content.location: Rightmost route of a group of three routes on the brown-yellow wall across from Bonnie Lass.

content.description: Managing Tight Lips is on the yellow-brown south facing wall and has only a shallow lip after the thin crack pinches out.
content.location: About straight across the canyon from Bonnie Lass and the middle route on a short section of wall having 3 routes.

content.description: Lean Off follows a steep wide shallow crack slot that right leans upward and cross a few block tops to the anchors.
content.location: Leftmost route on the south facing side of Gneiss Canyon near the Laramie River.

content.description: A continual steep climb on the blocks of rock that goes past some bulges that are separated with intermittent cracks.
content.location: Leftmost route on the brown-yellow wall accross from Bonnie Lass.

climbs.name: Genuine Ostrich (3 Payments)
climbs.fa: FA: Jason and Erin Haas, Bryan Prater 10/2020

content.description: Begin about 40 feet right of Fish Angling and 10 left of Eye Bleech. Swing up jugs to a prominent fin jutting out of the wall at the third bolt. Sink the locker kneebar, fire the crux, and enjoy mellow, 5.10 climbing to the anchor.
Fish Angling slants up & to the right using face and crack.
content.location: Fish Angling is located to the left of the low end of Gneiss Cyn and is along side the Laramie River.

climbs.name: Eye Bleech
climbs.fa: FA: Keith North, Jeff Slater, Austin Leech, Jason Haas 10/2020

content.description: Start under a four-foot roof that begins about 12 feet off the ground. Power out the roof and continue up a sustained face, catching rests where you can as this thing never lets up until the chains are clipped.

climbs.name: Diamond in the Lichen
climbs.fa: FA: Jason Haas, Jim Wong, Lenny Miller, Erika Nelson-Wong, Erin Haas 10/2020

content.description: You must like razor-crimping to appreciate this edging test piece. Find an orange lichen streak 20 feet left of Fish Angling. Stick clip the first bolt and then angle up left along the incipient seam to an intimidating mantel. Once on the ledge, regain your composure before flowing up terrifically fun edges that leads to a brief crack section. Swing left and up to the anchor in a hanging left-facing dihedral.
Mostly face with a few intermittent cracks.
content.location: First route right of Staged Access.

content.description: Some large brown crystals permit movement thru  a zone of steep rock.
content.location: It the route 4 right of Staged Access and begins on a boulder near a corner.

content.description: A face climb that angle to the right into a more desparate single pinch face move to a more difficult clip.
content.location: 3 rd route to the right of Staged Access.

content.description: Bonnie Lass is a moderately steep face climb on the black colored north facing wall of Gneiss Canyon.
content.location: The leftmost route on the south wall of Gneiss Cyn and is just right of a corner.

pathTokens: Laramie Peak Wildlife Habitat Management Area
